intro: Perityle cuneata var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, finely toothed margin. The flowers are small and white, arranged in flat-topped clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in native gardens.
